title: Ticket #6679: Add submit from foreach itemdata to python bindings
description:
It should be possible to use the full range of QUEUE statements when submitting using the python bindings. In order to do this, it will be necessary to spool the itemdata because from python we cannot necessarily write it into the current working directory as we do now in condor_submit.

The python bindings will be changed as follows

The Submit class constructor will accept a string in addition to the current dictionary. If a string is supplied, it will be parsed as a submit file and will allow a single QUEUE statement with all of the currently supported syntax.

When Submit.queue() is called without any arguments other than the transaction, it will use any arguments and itemdata supplied to the Submit constructor. if a count argument is supplied and it is not the same as the count supplied to the constructor, an error will be thrown.

New methods and members will be added to the Submit class to allow the queue arguments to be set and queried, and to allow for the itemdata from the QUEUE statement of the submit file to be iterated. 

    Submit.getQArgs() return the arguments from the QUEUE statement
    Submit.setQArgs(string) change the arguments for the QUEUE statement
    Submit.itemdata() iterate the itemdata from the QUEUE statement

A new method will be added to Submit to allow the queue itemdata to be supplied by a python iterator 

    Submit.queue_with_itemdata(txn, count, iter)  submit jobs from iter

When this method is used count jobs will be queued for each item returned by iter. The iterator may be any python iterator that returns either strings or dictionaries. If a dictionary is returned, then all dictionaries returned must use the same key names.

The iiterator returned by Submit.itemdata() may be used here. So, for example 

python submit code fragment
sub = htcondor.Submit("""
  Executable = /bin/echo
  QUEUE Args in (Wisconsin Nebraska Texas)
""")

with schedd.transaction() as txn : sub.queue(txn)
Will submit 3 jobs, one for each state. while this 
alternate submit using itemdata explicitly
with schedd.transaction() as txn :
   sub.queue_with_itemdata(txn, 3, iter(sub.itemdata())

Will queue 9 jobs - 3 for each state
